ygData.subject: Re: The Man (?) Behind the Curtain
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Well, some people do mind and there is nothing wrong with that, but I have met so many interesting people during beta. I met a group of Japanese
ygData.messageBody:
>No.
>
>At least most of the time. People's characters are their characters and
>that's who I know them as. Good enough for me. That's what a roleplaying
>game is about.
>
>Not that it's bad to wonder. But I hate when people ask me prying
>questions too.
>
>---
>Jesse <j@...>
>http://www.lumiere.net/
>

Well, some people do mind and there is nothing wrong with that, but I have
met so many interesting people during beta.

I met a group of Japanese role-players who were part of a japanese online
gaming magazine (the name of it evades me at the moment). They were very
cool, and I had many fun adventures with them. I kinda figured it out
because they "typed" mainly broken english. (If any of you know Ryuzem,
Sapphirezz, Beni, or Layel, tell them I said "Hi from Tavyn!" Oh and if you
see Ryuzem let me know what server he is on, haven't spoken to him since
beta 3.)

One of my party members was an expecting mother, and had her child during
beta and was out for a couple weeks. Another one was a student from
Argentina, and I met a few more from Japan.

Normally I'll only ask if it's someone I party with alot though.

Sartori of Kelethin
